author: greystroke
content: What's next you think? 90 mgas blocks and then decreasing slot time to 6s which together would be an effective tripling?

author: tersec
content: the slot time decrease has been consistently presented as being gas limit-independent, i.e not a backdoor way of doubling gas limits

author: tersec
content: it's a big enough change on its own

author: tersec
content: this is not a comment either way on gas limit increases per se

author: greystroke
content: It gets you to the same place either way (assuming clients would be able to handle a gas doubling when SSS goes in). Though, that brings up a bigger point.  If the slot time is now a variable which may change in future hard forks, we should stop discussing the gas limit as amount of gas per slot but instead as gas per unit of time (mgas/s).

author: sky.cactus
content: Slot time changes should *always* come with a compensatory gas limit change.  We should not be trying to sneak in gas limit increases by adjusting the slot time (same for increasing slot time, gas limit should increase).

author: sky.cactus
content: Ideally, client configs would specify "gas per second" rather than "gas per block".

author: tersec
content:
the latter part is an important point.

But yeah, at least each of the gas limit increases so far has had to content with specific blockers (the 36M -> 45M one had to wait for pectra, etc), and specific risks (contracts found which unintentionally used mispriced opcodes), or were feasible within a fork but prompted specific benchmarking and performance improvements (going to 60M).

These are substantial efforts both in terms of individual clients and ecosystem coordination entirely aside from a slot time decrease

author: tersec
content: so tying the two together is a good way of stalling one or both

author: tersec
content: i.e. ending up in a situation where, ok, the slot time decrease can work, but people aren't sure about a sudden doubling of the gas limit, so neither happens

author: greystroke
content: You make a good point that gas limit increases should be separately implemented from slot time changes.
